title: Why DeFi’s Woes May Be Existential
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: Since 2019, hackers have raided DeFi protocols nearly 500 times, absconding with $6 billion, proving that smart contracts are no match for smarter miscreants.

title: Brine Fi Raises $16.5 Million As It Aims To Broaden The DEX Market
author: David Prosser
description: Brine Fi believes demand for decentralised exchanges will continue to grow amid concern about the security of centralised platforms

title: How The New (Proposed) IRS Crypto Tax Rules Will Impact DeFi
author: Sean Stein Smith
description: Crypto taxes are changing yet again, this time with DeFi as the main focus

title: Layer 2 Wars Heat Up As Coinbase Launches Base
author: Leeor Shimron
description: Coinbase officially launched the public mainnet for its long-awaited Base layer 2 blockchain network on August 9. It is the first public company to release a blockchain.

title: Regulators' Hostility To DeFi Players Cools Crypto Innovation
author: Fatemeh Fannizadeh
description: CFTC charges three entities related to the development of decentralized financial marketplaces in an unprecedented hostile approach towards the crypto space.

title: The Secretive World Of MEV, Where Bots Front-Run Crypto Investors For Big Profits
author: Jeff Kauflin
description: True believers say crypto is more transparent than traditional finance. Yet that openness—combined with clunky infrastructure and an absence of regulation–lets crypto trading firms with lightning-fast bots prey on unsuspecting retail traders.

title: With Sam Bankman-Fried's Hedge Fund Gone, Crypto Trading Firm Wintermute Emerges
author: Jeff Kauflin
description: By deftly navigating crypto’s frontier markets and winning big on the collapse of Terra’s stable coin, Wintermute has grown into one of the world’s leading crypto trading firms. Now it must navigate a market littered with carcasses and landmines.

title: Arbitrum’s Token Airdrop Sends Network Adoption Soaring
author: Leeor Shimron
description: Arbitrum released its long-awaited token airdrop last week to widespread fanfare. Its successful launch has crypto enthusiasts eagerly awaiting more such giveaways.

title: More Than Half Of All Bitcoin Trades Are Fake
author: Javier Paz
description: A new Forbes analysis of 157 crypto exchanges finds that 51% of the daily bitcoin trading volume being reported is likely bogus.

title: Blockchain Interoperability: The Tab Switching Of Web 3.0
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Learn how the web3 ecosystem works, and what the limitations are

title: Web3 And Crypto Capitals: A Global Perspective
author: Sandy Carter
description: As the crypto market boasts a total market cap of US$1.3 trillion – close to the market cap of Amazon – the landscape for these decentralized technologies is evolving.

title: Over $3 Billion Stolen In Crypto Heists: Here Are The Eight Biggest
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: It was a record year for crypto hacks. Decentralized finance was the prime target, accounting for two thirds of all hacks.

title: KKR Blockchain Access To $4 Billion Fund Opens Door To Crypto Investors
author: Michael del Castillo
description: Fractionalized investments bring financial providers to the scene as regulators struggle with noncompliant crypto companies.

title: Crypto Investing—A New Investor's Guide
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Crypto investing is much more than just buying bitcoin. There are a range of options depending on your risk appetite. This guide will help you get started.

title: Crypto Exchanges: What Investors Need To Know
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Crypto exchanges were developed as a simple way for investors to buy digital assets. Learn about the difference between centralized and decentralized exchanges.

title: Beware Of Flatcoins, Crypto’s Inflation Busting Fad
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: These coins are designed to protect stablecoin holders from inflation. But they are complicated and it’s not clear whether they will actually work.

title: Shining A Light On Crypto Market Capitalization
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: A simple definition for market cap is the value of all outstanding shares by the current share price.

title: What Is DeFi?
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Decentralized finance, or DeFi for short, replicates traditional financial functions through smart contracts on a blockchain.

title: The ‘Game May Be Over’—Legendary Billionaire Investor Issues Stark Fed Warning Amid Wild Bitcoin, Ethereum And Crypto Price Swings
author: Billy Bambrough
description: Billionaire hedge fund manager Paul Tudor Jones has warned "the game" of buying bitcoin as an inflation hedge might be over...

title: NFT Marketplace Wars Heat Up As Blur’s Airdrop Drives It To The Top Spot
author: Leeor Shimron
description: On February 14th, NFT trading platform and aggregator Blur rewarded its users with its highly anticipated token airdrop. It flipped the recovering NFT industry on its head.

title: Crypto CEO - The Traditional Way Of Moving Assets Across Blockchains Is A ‘Horrible Construct’
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: LayerZero Labs CEO Bryan Pellegrino says that the current bridges used to transfer assets between networks are rife with security risks. His firm's solutions look to make it much safer to move everything from money to data.

title: What Is A DAO? A Beginner’s Guide To Joining A DAO
author: Steve Larsen
description: To familiarize yourself with the DAO ecosystem, conducting thorough research is essential.

title: TRM Labs’ Financial-Service Backers Come Back For More In $70 Million Series B Expansion
author: Mitchell Martin
description: PayPal, Amex, Citi all increase stakes in blockchain security firm as DeFi hacks escalate.

title: Ethereum Miners Will Have Few Good Options After The Merge
author: Colin Harper
description: There are two options on the table: Mine other GPU-compatible coins like Ethereum Classic (ETC) or switch to the ETHPoW fork. Neither will come close to offering compatible rewards.

title: What Are DApp Tokens?
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Learn what DApp tokens are, and how the protocols utilize them to offer services

title: Ethereum’s Centralized And Decentralized Liquid Staking Providers Battle For Dominance
author: Leeor Shimron
description: Staking can be a valuable way to support network health and earn additional yield on crypto, but in the past users have been forced to sacrifice liquidity for this opportunity. A new crop of providers is looking to eliminate that tradeoff.

title: The IRS Is Working On A New Tax Form To Capture Your Crypto Activity
author: Shehan Chandrasekera
description: The IRS is reportedly working on introducing a brand new tax form called Form 1099-DA for exchanges to capture individual annual cryptocurrency activity subject to taxation.

title: Web3 - A Transformative And Disruptive Multi-Trillion-Dollar Opportunity To Service Billions
author: Roomy Khan
description: Web3 sector will grow at a roughly 50 percent compound annual growth rate (CAGR) to become a multi-trillion-dollar industry over the next decade. Web3 could go from a buzzword to mainstream, disrupting existing businesses while creating massive new markets.

title: Coinbase Blockchain Plan Gets Warm Reception; Success Hinges On Converting Crypto Diehards
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: The company has been trying to move beyond its core exchange business. It’s latest effort is to build a new Ethereum network called Base to become a hub of blockchain activity.

title: Bankruptcy And Crypto
author: Nizan Geslevich Packin
description: We’re about to find out the hard way just how protected crypto investors are in the event of collapse of crypto firms, as crypto is being put on trial in bankruptcy courts for the first time.

title: How Crypto Trading Firm Wintermute Was Hacked For $160 Million
author: Jeff Kauflin
description: CEO Gaevoy says Wintermute will continue to trade in DeFi, even though playing in decentralized markets made his firm more vulnerable to losses.

title: Crypto Exchanges Fight ‘Gravitational Pull’ To Delist Assets Deemed Securities
author: Emily Mason
description: Following a lawsuit alleging insider trading of nine crypto assets deemed securities hundreds of exchanges are left wondering whether to appease the SEC.

title: Coinbase NFT Partner 0x Labs Raises $70 Million From Greylock Partners, Jump Crypto, and Jared Leto
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: Following the successful integration with Coinbase’s newly launched NFT marketplace, the San-Francisco-based startup plans to dabble further into the NFT tech and decentralized finance.

title: How To Identify A Good Cryptocurrency Project To Hold For The Long Term
author: Roselyne Wanjiru
description: This fundamentally makes Bitcoin a building block, and we see this in projects using its code.

title: DEXs Gain Market Share As Faith In Centralized Crypto Players Erodes
author: Leeor Shimron
description: Billions of dollars in crypto are steaming off of the world's biggest exchanges. Decentralized alternatives are looking to capitalize.

title: Apple, Google, Amazon, And Tesla Stock Prices Are Now Available To DeFi And Other Crypto Platforms
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: The Pyth network, a decentralized oracle that brings financial data across asset classes on-chain–is working to bring institutional grade price feeds to the world of crypto.

title: SEC Regulation Of DeFi Could Box Out Diverse Entrepreneurs And Impact Projects
author: Cleve Mesidor
description: SEC Chair Gary Gensler’s regulation by enforcement approach may derail decentralized finance, setting up roadblocks for diverse entrepreneurs and impact projects.

title: Hackers Steal Another $100 Million In Crypto From A Blockchain Transfer Protocol, Total Lost In 2022 Above $1 Billion
author: Maria Gracia Santillana Linares
description: Harmony’s Horizon bridge joins Ronin and Wormhole in exploited blockchain bridges in 2022, totaling $1 billion stolen.

title: Kim Kardashian’s $1 Million Fine Could Impact Uniswap, SushiSwap And Other Decentralized Exchanges
author: Michael del Castillo
description: Investigation into mysterious cryptocurrency could answer longstanding questions about how regulators will respond to securities traded on Uniswap, SushiSwap and other decentralized exchanges.

title: Celsius Holders Use Self Custody To Foil Short Sellers
author: Maria Gracia Santillana Linares
description: The #celshortsqueeze movement echoes GameStop campaign of 2021.

title: Beyond Crypto Custody: Fireblocks Unveils Web3 Engine To Support DeFi, Games And NFTs
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: Blockchain infrastructure provider Fireblocks has launched a suite of developer tools and a portal for customers to access cryptocurrency exchanges, NFT marketplaces and other decentralized applications across multiple networks.

title: Lummis-Gillibrand Crypto Bill: An Important Step In Bringing Regulatory Clarity To Bitcoin, Stablecoins, & Digital Assets
author: Avik Roy
description: If the Responsible Financial Innovation Act were to become law, the U.S. could instantly leapfrog its competitors and become the world leader in crypto innovation and inclusion. Here’s why.

title: Have FTX And ASX Killed The Promise Of Blockchain?
author: Richard Gendal Brown
description: You would be forgiven for thinking everything is broken in the world of blockchain. Yet some remarkable success stories are emerging, hidden in plain sight. What explains the divergent outcomes for different projects this year?

title: Does Decentralized Governance Work?
author: Steven Ehrlich
description: Although in theory executives are subject to the oversight of shareholders and focused on creating long-term value for these constituents, this does not happen in practice.

title: After The Merge, Ethereum Looks To Rollups - And Bigger Challenges Ahead
author: Faisal Khan
description: As the energy around the Merge reached a crescendo that echoed through Wall Street, the obscure tech enthusiasts known as ‘core devs’ ascended to rockstar status.

title: Decoding DeFi's Hidden Value
author: Leanne Kemp
description: Data has a way of cutting through the noise and providing clear insights into industry progress.

title: Stablecoin Issuers May Be Crypto Industry’s Achilles’ Heel
author: León Markovitz
description: When New York regulators ordered the crypto exchange Paxos to stop minting stablecoins this week, it revealed one of the Ethereum ecosystem’s greatest weaknesses: Fiat-backed stablecoin issuers that must obey laws in their respective jurisdictions.

title: Circle’s Euro-Backed Stablecoin Is About To Launch
author: Diana Barrero Zalles
description: As Circle’s second digital currency, EUROC is designed to adhere to the same regulatory and operational standards as USDC. However, its long term success will depend on its positioning vis-a-vis a digital Euro and its ability to acquire mainstream partners.

title: Crypto’s Huge Volume Spike On Monday Signals Potential Market Bottom
author: Javier Paz
description: Reported activity from various retail and institutional crypto marketplaces exhibited sharp trading spikes on Monday, with Gibraltar-based LMAX Digital, one of the largest institutional spot bitcoin trading venues, seeing total notional volume of $1.79 billion, a 261% increase over the 30-day ave...

title: Claims That DeFi Is Unraveling Or Structurally Flawed Are Unfounded
author: Dushyant Shahrawat
description: The notion that DeFi is somehow to blame for the current problems in Crypto originates from a lack of fundamental understanding of the differences between traditional finance, CeFi, and DeFi, and how DeFi actually works. Almost all the models that failed are CeFi models, and not DeFi.

title: Back To Basics: 3 Key Differences Between DeFi And Centralized Finance Platforms
author: Sean Lee
description: DeFi is proving the benefits of giving up sole control over both protocol governance and users’ assets, surviving market turbulence without any major failures

title: Solana Coin, Silvergate Plunge As FTX Contagion Spreads
author: Nina Bambysheva
description: Tokens associated with Bankman-Fried crash by double-digit percentages, Silvergate shares punished.
